intro: Nesaea linifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small white or yellowish flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nesaea linifolia is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
